properties.name: El Café
properties.description: Population: 200Coordinates: +18° 46' 31.51", -70° 14' 11.18"Distance from Santo Domingo: 61 km NAverage Annual Income: 1,800The farmers of El Café depend largely on their oregano crop, yet in recent years deforestation has caused erosion and threatened the livelihood of the community. The village elders have welcomed the help of Plant With Purpose to replenish the soil that has been depleted and to develop alternative ways of creating income so that they don’t have to cut down more of their trees. Plant With Purpose has teamed up with the community to start a nursery where villagers grow seedlings, fruit trees, and other plant to replenish the sparse forests and provide income. Plant With Purpose has also set up a solar drier to help them turn their oregano into a storable, marketable good. In addition to the nursery and solar driers, Plant With Purpose offers workshops to teach sustainable farming methods and other ways to conserve the land. Give now and help the farmers of El Café restore their land, boost their income, and transform their lives.

properties.name: La Joya
properties.description: Population: 214Coordinates: +18° 50' 34.48", -70° 18' 52.06"Distance from Santo Domingo: 48 km NAverage Annual Income: 2,000Historically the people of La Joya have made a living from breeding pigs and cattle in addition to growing coffee and grapefruit. But deforestation has led to soil erosion and diminished coffee yields as well as leaving less fodder for pigs and cattle to eat. As the community grows, unsustainable farming practices threaten productivity and the very well being of the community. With increasing soil erosion leading to infertile, unproductive land, the village is in critical need of Plant With Purpose’s sustainable agriculture training and environmentally friendly, income generating projects. By supporting Plant With Purpose in La Joya, you will be empowering farmers to apply soil conservation techniques that replenish and restore their land. Additionally you will be providing families with low interest loans to invest in sustainable businesses and overcome poverty. Through Plant With Purpose community groups, families and neighbors will strengthen their relationships, pool their resources, and learn new ways to provide for the families, protect their land, and transform their lives. Don’t miss your chance to be a part of the amazing transformation taking place in the hearts and lives of the people of La Joya.

properties.name: La Lomita
properties.description: Population: 300Location: near Villa AltagraciaCoordinates: +18° 39' 55.44", -70° 13' 28.38"Average Annual Income: $2,000With unpaved roads, steep hillside farms, and a lack of water and electricity, the small community of La Lomita is completely dependent on agriculture for survival. Farmers eke out a living growing cacao, pigeon peas, rice, and beans on their barren, depleted hills. This small community of about 300 people is very poor and, like most of the villages where Plant With Purpose works in the Dominican Republic, the poor live in the valley but walk several kilometers to farm the steep hillsides surrounding the town. In addition to providing economic, environmental, and spiritual assistance, helping farmers find sustainable methods of farming these steep hillsides is a high priority for Plant With Purpose.

properties.name: La Yautia
properties.description: Population: 639Coordinates: +18° 45' 0.00", -70° 45' 0.00"Distance from Santo Domingo: 83 km NAverage Annual Income: 1,800The village of La Yautia suffers from deforestation and environmental degradation. Desperate farmers have cut down large areas of forested land, clearing it for farming and/or to sell the cut trees as fuel wood. The La Yautia region has been especially affected by severe deforestation and devastating floods, most recently as a result of tropical storm Noel. Farmers lost their entire harvest and parents lost their children to the floods. The people of La Yautia are wonderful, skilled people who have become trapped in a vicious cycle of poverty and deforestation from which they see little hope of escape. Plant With Purpose works in this devastated region to teach farmers to work with, not against, the land. By fostering environmental restoration, economic opportunity, and spiritual renewal, Plant With Purpose empowers rural farmers to transform their lives. There is both tremendous need and also an openness and desire on the part of the local community to partner with Plant With Purpose to bring about positive change in the community. Help the people of La Yautia restore their land, overcome poverty, and improve their lives.

properties.name: Los Arroyones
properties.description: Population: 284Coordinates: +18° 44' 6.72", -70° 12' 46.84"Distance from Santo Domingo: 59 km NAverage Annual Income: 1,800The village of Los Arroyones began as a community of day laborers— primarily Haitians—who toiled in the vast sugarcane fields. When the plantation owner left, the farmers fought to stay on their land. Today, the people of Los Arroyones struggle to survive on the now desolate plains that they fought so hard to keep. Plant With Purpose empowers these desperate farmers to get the most out of their land. By teaching sustainable agriculture techniques and providing access to credit, Plant With Purpose is helping the community come together to overcome poverty. We invite you to partner with us on this exciting project that is empowering the farmers of Los Arroyones to transform their lives by fighting poverty and deforestation, creating sustainable enterprise, and restoring their land and their dignity. Join us as we plant hope in Los Arroyones.

properties.name: Los Mogotes
properties.description: Population: 566Coordinates: +18° 44' 24.00", -70° 15' 28.80"Distance from Santo Domingo: 60 km NAverage Annual Income: 2,000 The clip-clop of horses can be heard throughout the day as villagers ride through the well-worn dirt roads of Los Mogotes. Children bike and chase chickens as the older folks discuss the news of the day under sparse palm trees. The dusty soil provides much more than a thoroughfare across town: because Los Mogotes is a farming community, the soil is their lifeblood. Unfortunately, deforestation has led to severe soil erosion and the land isn’t producing like it used to. Plant With Purpose is working with the people of Los Mogotes to improve and preserve the soil on which they depend for trees for timber, tropical fruits, and oregano. Projects such as a community tree nursery allow villagers to work together to care for their land, plan for the future, and transform their lives. With your help, the people of Los Mogotes will be empowered to care for the valuable soil that supports laughing children, galloping horses, and the very livelihood of the town itself.

properties.name: Piedra Blanca
properties.description: Population: 3,000Coordinates: +18° 50' 0.00", -70° 19' 0.00"Distance from Santo Domingo: 70 km NAverage Annual Income: 2,500In the village of Piedra Blanca, which literally means “White Stone,” credit and business opportunities are hard to find. Parents struggle to support their families and feed their children. With your help, Plant With Purpose will provide community members with small loans and the opportunity to use their talents and skills, such as growing vegetables or making mops, to improve their lives and support their families. Not only will the people of Piedra Blanca learn to support themselves, but their businesses will provide employment and empowerment for many other people in the community as well. Offering hope and opportunity through small loans is just one of the many ways Plant With Purpose partners with the people of Piedra Blanca to transform their lives.

properties.name: Zumbador
properties.description: Population: 635Coordinates: +18° 26' 57.70", -70° 11' 32.86"Distance from Santo Domingo: 80 km NAverage Annual Income: 2,000While the Zumbador valley is lush and green with a flowing river, the hillsides are often cut and burned to use as cropland, threatening to erode essential topsoil and pollute the village’s water supply. Through Plant With Purpose’s training, many farmers are starting to understand that “slashing and burning” the forest for cropland will not work in the long-term. As problems with deforestation and erosion worsen, the river gets choked with the soil and sediment that washes off the hillsides. Plant With Purpose’s work helps keep the waters clean and the community healthy and vibrant. Plant With Purpose does this by providing alternatives. In the middle of some of these cleared areas are large plots of forest and fruit trees that have been planted by the local community with the help and encouragement of Plant With Purpose. Tender seedlings planted in the new community nursery ensure that the rich valley of Zumbador will stay lush and green and the river will continue to flow with life-giving water. Join Plant With Purpose and the village of Zumbador as they work to restore their environment, transform their lives, and a build a better future for their families.
